data_table.description: Physical Examination Form, Exam 2. Participants with or without atherosclerosis and cardiovascular disease and involved in the "Atherosclerosis Risk in Communities (ARIC) Cohort" project.

variable.name: PHEBFLAG
variable.description: =1 if form is present [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEBCY
variable.description: Contact year [4] [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB01
variable.description: [AFU chest pain conformation]. Did the participant report positive rose angina in the annual follow-up call preceding this visit? Q1 [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB02
variable.description: [AFU chest pain conformation]. In the ARIC telephone call you mentioned having some pain or discomfort in your chest in the past year. Could you tell me where it was? Q2 [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB02A
variable.description: [AFU chest pain conformation]. In the ARIC telephone call you mentioned having some pain or discomfort in your chest in the past year. Could you tell me where it was: sternum (upper or middle). Q2A [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB02B
variable.description: [AFU chest pain conformation]. In the ARIC telephone call you mentioned having some pain or discomfort in your chest in the past year. Could you tell me where it was: sternum (Lower) Q2B [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB02C
variable.description: [AFU chest pain conformation]. In the ARIC telephone call you mentioned having some pain or discomfort in your chest in the past year. Could you tell me where it was: left anterior chest. Q2C [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB02D
variable.description: [AFU chest pain conformation]. In the ARIC telephone call you mentioned having some pain or discomfort in your chest in the past year. Could you tell me where it was: left arm. Q2D [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB02E
variable.description: [AFU chest pain conformation]. In the ARIC telephone call you mentioned having some pain or discomfort in your chest in the past year. Could you tell me where it was: other. Q2E [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB03
variable.description: [AFU chest pain conformation]. In the past two months has your chest discomfort either occurred more often, lasted longer when it occurs, or come on at rest? Q3 [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB04
variable.description: [Invasive procedure]. Have you ever had surgery on your heart, or the arteries of your neck or legs, excluding surgery for varicose veins? Q4 [Probe for type of invasive procedure] [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB05A
variable.description: [Invasive procedure]. [Probe for type of invasive procedure]. Coronary Bypass Q5A [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB05B
variable.description: [Invasive procedure]. [Probe for type of invasive procedure]. Other heart procedure. Q5B [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB05C
variable.description: [Invasive procedure]. [Probe for type of invasive procedure]. Carotid endarterectomy. Q5C [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB05D
variable.description: [Invasive procedure]. [Probe for type of invasive procedure]. Site Q5D [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB05E
variable.description: [Invasive procedure]. [Probe for type of invasive procedure]. Other arterial revascularization. Q5E [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB05F
variable.description: [Invasive procedure]. [Probe for type of invasive procedure]. Other type of invasive procedure. Q5F [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB06
variable.description: [Invasive procedure]. Have you ever had a balloon angioplasty on the arteries of your heart or legs? Q6 [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB07A
variable.description: [Invasive procedure]. [Probe for type of procedure]. Have you ever had a balloon angioplasty on the arteries of your heart or legs? Angioplasty of coronary artery(ies). Q7A [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB07B
variable.description: [Invasive procedure]. [Probe for type of procedure]. Have you ever had a balloon angioplasty on the arteries of your heart or legs? Angioplasty of lower extremity arteries. Q7B [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB08A
variable.description: [Invasive procedure]. Have you ever had: heart catheterization. Q8A [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB08B
variable.description: [Invasive procedure]. Have you ever had: other arterial catheterization. Q8B [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB09A
variable.description: [Diagnostic procedures]. Since your last visit to the ARIC clinic, have you had any of the following procedures performed? Echocardiogram. Q9A [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB09B
variable.description: [Diagnostic procedures]. Since your last visit to the ARIC clinic, have you had any of the following procedures performed? Electrocardiogram. Q9B [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB09C
variable.description: [Diagnostic procedures]. Since your last visit to the ARIC clinic, have you had any of the following procedures performed? Treadmill or cardiac stress test. Q9C [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB09D
variable.description: [Diagnostic procedures]. Since your last visit to the ARIC clinic, have you had any of the following procedures performed? Carotid ultrasound studies. Q9D [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB09E
variable.description: [Diagnostic procedures]. Since your last visit to the ARIC clinic, have you had any of the following procedures performed? Heart catheterization. Q9E [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB10
variable.description: [Walking/standing]. Does the participant use a wheelchair, crutches, or walker? Q10 [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB11
variable.description: [Walking/standing]. Does the participant walk with a cane? Q11 [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB12
variable.description: [Walking/standing]. The participant's gait is... Q12 [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB12A
variable.description: [Walking/standing]. Dystaxic gait? Q12A [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB12B
variable.description: [Walking/standing]. Hemiplegic or hemiparetic gait? Q12B [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB13
variable.description: [Walking/standing]. Is there arm weakness? Q13 [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB14
variable.description: [Walking/standing]. Rhomberg? Q14 [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB15
variable.description: [Neck]. Carotid bruits? Q15 [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB16
variable.description: [Neck]. Other head or neck findings? Q16 [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB17
variable.description: [Cardio pulmonary]. Rhonchi? Q17 [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB18
variable.description: [Cardio pulmonary]. Rales? Q18 [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB19
variable.description: [Cardio pulmonary]. Other chest findings? Q19 [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB20
variable.description: [Cardio pulmonary]. Systolic murmur? Q20 [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB20A
variable.description: [Cardio pulmonary]. Systolic murmur grade. Q20a [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]
variable.value: Intermediate and increasing in intensity, palpable as a thrill
Louder, palpable, still requires the stethoscope

variable.name: PHEB20B
variable.description: [Cardio pulmonary]. Systolic murmur location. Q20B [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB21
variable.description: [Cardio pulmonary]. Diastolic murmur? Q21 [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB21A
variable.description: [Cardio pulmonary]. Diastolic murmur grade Q21a [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]
variable.value: Intermediate and increasing in intensity, palpable as a thrill

variable.name: PHEB21B
variable.description: [Cardio pulmonary]. Diastolic murmur location. Q21B [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB22
variable.description: [Cardio pulmonary]. Other heart findings? Q22 [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB23
variable.description: [Lower extremities]. Ankle edema? Q23 [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB23A
variable.description: [Lower extremities]. Right ankle edema? Q23A [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB23B
variable.description: [Lower extremities]. Left ankle edema? Q23B [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB24
variable.description: [Lower extremities]. Posterior tibial pulse? Q24 [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB25
variable.description: [ Lower extremities]. Other extremity findings? Q25 [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB26
variable.description: [ Lower extremities]. Babinski? Q26 [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: PHEB27
variable.description: [General]. Other significant phys findings? Q27 [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]

variable.name: GWAS_ID
variable.description: ARIC subject ID [Physical Examination Form, exam 2]
